Lack enough support: The claim lacks support as there is no evidence or statement from any US senator praising Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no US senator with the name "Tony Booker" as mentioned in the misleading post.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the praise from a US senator, even if it were true, would validate the selection or election of Imran Khan as the best choice and the wisdom of the Pakistani nation.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the alleged praise by stating that it would make Pakistanis the most wise nation in the world.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by using a false name for the US senator and presenting it as a fact.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation mentioned in the given information.
